required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Confounding Factors in Ocular Surface Microbiome Research
clinical_study.official_title: Confounding Factors in Ocular Surface Microbiome Research

brief_summary.textblock: To elucidate confounding factors in ocular surface microbiome research and to confirm the presence of a core ocular surface microbiome and its temporal stability.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigator will take a conjunctival sample of both eyes of a group of volunteers together with an extensive questionnaire. Furthermore, 50 volunteers will be sampled repeatedly during one year or two years.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A conjunctival swab will be taken from healthy volunteers

primary_outcome.measure: Richness and evenness of distribution of the microbial flora measured as operational taxonomic units on a single moment
primary_outcome.time_frame: 20 minutes for samples and filling the questionnaires
primary_outcome.description: A conjunctival swab and extensive questionnaire will be taken to search for a core ocular surface microbiome and confounding factors

primary_outcome.measure: Change in richness and evenness of distribution of the microbial flora, measured as operational taxonomic units, over time
primary_outcome.time_frame: 20 minutes for the first sample and questionnaire, 5 minutes for all other visits
primary_outcome.description: A conjunctival swab will be taken on different points in time to investigate the temporal stability of the conjunctival microbial flora

intervention.description: A conjunctival swab of both eyes will be taken at the same time together with an extensive questionnaire.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The subject is fluent in written and verbal Dutch
- The subject is capable of giving informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of glaucoma drops
- Use of antibiotic drops < 1 month before sampling

facility.name: University Hospitals Leuven, Department of Ophthalmology
